1CT Videos
Covington Schools Web Video Series

1CT videos provide relavent information and visual connections to various areas of Covington Schools. Topics include information from administrators, staff interviews, department updates, educational expectations, and student guidance.
Congratulations to all Seniors! "Senior Spotlights" have been assembled to share the many favorite teachers, memories, activities, and plans.

div.div:
Superintendent Dr. Kevin Smith Welcome to Covington Community School Corporation!
It is my honor to welcome you to the “Home of the Trojans”. I am proud to have the opportunity to represent the students, parents, staff, Board of Trustees and the school-community members of CCSC as we provide a laser focus on the growth and development of our children.
(Read More...)

div.style: padding:6px; border: 1px solid #aaaaaa; background-color:#DDDDDD; border-radius: 5px; float: right; font-size: 11px;

div.p:
Thursday, March 12, 2020
Covington High School Announcements
Today
We have more Regional Tickets for sale. See Mrs. Linville in the high school office.

Regional Basketball tickets are on sale in the high school office. Tickets are $10.00 for an All-Session ticket. Single session tickets are $8.00 at the door and will not be for presale at the school.
First come – first serve.

Dress up days for Regional week are:
Friday: Crazy Black and Gold

The indoor golf NETGAIN will not be in session the rest of this week. First HS golf practice starts Monday, March 16 at 3:30 pm at Rivercrest. All team players be there ready to practice. Make sure you have an athletic physical on file in the office.
Students that plan to bring a prom guest from a different school -stop by the office to get permission slips.
REMINDERS

Please remember to check your lunch balance in Harmony. If you are in the minus NO extras or seconds. If your balance is over -$15.00, you will be given an alternate lunch, which includes a PB&J with a vegetable, fruit & milk.
The date for the Prom is Saturday, April 25 at the Beef House from 7:00 to 11:00 pm.

Covington High School 2020 yearbooks are now on sale. Cost is $50.00 You may pick up an order form in the high school office or order online at yearbookforever.com. Deadline date to order is March 20, 2020.

The 2019 Yearbooks have arrived. Graduates may pick them up from Mrs. Gee.
There several 2019 yearbooks left for purchase. If you would like to purchase
one the cost is $50.00.

To order school pictures online, please visit inter-state.com/order and use the
Code: 40159C.
Guidance:

This a reminder that any student wanting to apply for the first year of a vocational class OR continue with the 2nd year MUST complete an application ASAP. The site for the application has changed:
go to wrcte.org
click on the “Forms & Applications” at the top
select the Attica/Covington/Fountain Central/Seeger Application

The U.S. Census Bureau is looking to hire locally to help with the 2020 Census (part-time and full time jobs available). You must be at least 18, have a valid Social Security number and be a U.S. citizen. See Mrs. Myers or Mr. Ballard for more information, or go to 2020census.gov/jobs.
Sports

Saturday, March 14: Boys Basketball Regional at Frankfort High School 10:00 am
Covington vs Southwood

Saturday, March 14: Regional Championship Game at Frankfort High School 7:30 pm
(ticket says 8:00 pm but it is at 7:30pm)

div.style: padding:6px; border: 1px solid #aaaaaa; background-color:#DDDDDD; border-radius: 5px; float: right; font-size: 11px;

div.p: Good morning CMS
E-Learning Day – No School
REMINDERS:

Indoor golf NETGAIN in the Annex will not be in session this week or next. Middle School golfers who plan on playing golf this spring will have their first official practice on Monday, Mar. 30th, at Rivercrest from 3:30-5:00 pm. Come ready to practice. Make sure you have your athletic physicals completed and on file in the office.

FOOD DRIVE — 3/9-3/18
The Tektons have organized a Food Drive — Now through next Wednesday

Collection bins will be located in every middle school language classroom .
The goal is for all grades need to bring in at least 125 boxed or canned items, but if you can bring in more that would be great!
Lastly, there will be a special surprise for the grade that reaches the most canned/ boxed foods
Image result for clear background can food

8th Grade — The 8th grade field trip to Twin Lakes is April 6 & 7. The cost of the trip is $60.00 and is paid through your beef raffle ticket sales. If you sold all your assigned raffle tickets over the years, your trip is covered. There are several students who did not meet their sales goals. Please check with Mrs. Booe to see if any money is still owed toward your trip.

8th Grade: TO DO BEFORE
image.png
Turn in permission forms for Twin Lakes to Mr. Turner/Mr. Anderson
Check your balance for the Twin Lakes trip w/ Mrs. Booe
Any student who is 15 years old or will turn 15 soon is eligible for driver’s education. You can sign up at anytime at www.tenandtwodriving.com or by contacting Mr. Smaltz in the high school.

There will be a Hunter Safety Class on March 27th from 5-9pm and March 28th from 8am-3pm at the Fountain County 4H building. You can find more information and sign up for the event through the Fountain County 4H Shooting Sports Group on Facebook.

Please remember to check your lunch balance in Harmony. If you are in the minus NO extras or seconds. If your balance is over -$15.00, you will be given an alternate lunch, which includes a PB&J with a vegetable, fruit & milk.
All library books need to be returned or renewed as soon as possible.
If you are interested in playing in the Covington Youth Soccer League…pick up a packet in the middle school office.
Students: You are not allowed to stop at your lockers first thing in the morning unless you have permission from the office.

div.style: padding:6px; border: 1px solid #aaaaaa; background-color:#DDDDDD; border-radius: 5px; float: right; font-size: 11px;

div.p:
Feb. 28, 2020 Covington Elementary School Bulletin #27
***Working Together for Children***
CES WILL NO LONGER BE COLLECTING POP TABS.
DAYLIGHT SAVINGS TIME SUNDAY, MARCH 8. BE SURE AND SPRING FORWARD 1 HOUR!
CES YEARBOOKS ARE ON SALE NOW FOR $15.00. PLEASE MAKE CHECKS OUT TO INTER-STATE STUDIO & PUBLISHING CO. ORDERING DEADLINE — TUESDAY, MARCH 17, 2020.
COVINGTON HIGH SCHOOL IS HOSTING A BLOOD DRIVE ON MARCH 11 FROM 8:00AM TO 1:00PM IN THE MIDDLE SCHOOL GYM. PLEASE CONTACT CAROLYN DAVIS AT THE COVINGTON HIGH SCHOOL TO MAKE AN APPOINTMENT.
IREAD 3 State testing for 3rd grade will take place on March 16 and 17
SPRING BREAK MARCH 23 – 27

KINDERGARTEN ROUND UP WILL BE TUESDAY, APRIL 7, 2020 @ 6:00PM.
YOUR CHILD MUST BE 5 YEARS OLD BY AUGUST 1, 2020.
****CHECK IN SYSTEM AT CCSC. YOU WILL SIGN IN AT OFFICER LARRY’S DESK. ALSO, PLEASE BRING YOUR DRIVERS LICENSE.

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CHECK YOUR LUNCH BALANCE IN HARMONY. IF YOU ARE, IN THE MINUS NO EXTRAS OR SECONDS. IF YOUR BALANCE IF OVER –$15.00, YOU WILL BE GIVEN AN ALTERNATE LUNCH, WHICH INCLUDES A PB&J WITH A VEGETABLE, FRUIT, & MILK.
CES TROJAN GOLD DISCOUNT CARDS ON SALE NOW FOR $7.
**PARENTS/GUARDIANS PLEASE USE OUR NEW AUTOMATED SERVICE FOR ABSENCES.
ATTENTION! PLEASE DO NOT PARK YOUR VEHICLE IN FRONT OF THE SCHOOL AFTER 2:00PM. WE HAVE A COUPLE OF BUSES THAT NEED TO PICK UP STUDENTS AT THIS TIME OF THE DAY. THANK YOU!
STUDENTS WHO WALK TO SCHOOL IN THE MORNINGS….PLEASE DO NOT ARRIVE TO SCHOOL ANY EARLIER THAN 7:45AM DUE TO NO CROSSGUARDS ON DUTY (due to time) THIS IS FOR THE SAFETY OF OUR STUDENTS. THANK YOU!

CROSSING GUARDS WILL BE AVAILABLE FROM 7:45 – 8:00 IN THE MORNING. If you arrive at school after this time, please drive around to the front of the building to drop your child off for school. Car line and Walker doors are locked after 8:05a.m.

TRANSPORTATION CHANGES NEED TO BE SENT TO THE CHILD’S TEACHER. WE WILL NOT ALLOW STUDENTS TO CHANGE HIS/HER REGULAR ROUTINE WITHOUT A NOTE OR PHONE CALL TO THE OFFICE. THIS IS FOR THE SAFETY OF YOUR CHILD/REN.

BACKGROUND CHECKS for parents wanting to go on field trips can be obtained through the school website under the Superintendent’s tab. There is a fee for the process. Background checks are good for 2 years.

THE WINTER SEASON IS UPON US. PLEASE MAKE SURE YOUR CHILD IS WEARING A WINTER COAT TO SCHOOL. IF HE/SHE DOES NOT HAVE A WINTER COAT AND IS IN NEED, PLEASE NOTIFY THE OFFICE. IN ADDITION, CHILDREN WEARING SHORTS WILL NOT BE ALLOWED TO GO OUTSIDE FOR RECESS UNLESS THEY HAVE A PAIR OF PANTS TO PUT OVER THEIR SHORTS.
CES WILL BE COLLECTING BROKEN OR UNWANTED CRAYONS FOR RECYLING. THANK YOU!

INDIANA HUNTER EDUCATION CLASSES…There will be a meeting on Friday, March 27, 2020 from 5:00pm – 9:00pm and Saturday, March 28, 2020 from 8:00am – 3:00pm at the Fountain County 4-H building on Highway 136 Veedersburg. You can also register online @ www.hunter-ed.com
